article_text:
Inflation has persistently run below the Federal Reserve’s target in recent years, which has left central bankers perplexed.

This low inflation has, in turn, led investors to expect more of the same in coming years, judging by the behavior of regular and inflation-indexed bonds and inflation derivatives.

But fear of superlow inflation or even deflation may be getting out of hand. Goldman Sachs calculates that the fixed-income...
